intro: Carapa touloucouna, commonly known as the yellow balsa tree, is a tropical tree native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and yellowish flowers. The tree produces heavy, buoyant seeds enclosed in a fibrous, woody capsule. Its wood is lightweight and used in various traditional and commercial applications. The plant also has medicinal properties and is sometimes used in local remedies.
